message.content: {"id": "4971", "title": "Bug 4971 - Strange 'copy package'", "description": "Bug 4971 - When performing 'copy package' in org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui, the destination is not set correctly. Steps to reproduce: 1. Select a package in the project 2. Choose 'Copy' from the context menu.", "OB": "The 'copy package' functionality does not correctly set the destination package in org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.", "EB": "The destination package in org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui should be set correctly when performing 'copy package'.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue, create a new project and select a package. Choose 'Copy' from the context menu and ensure that the destination package is set correctly."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
